Text:
Iris is in the gardens of the royal palace, absorbed
in sword drills.
A memory of her younger years pops into her mind.

Felling the captain with a single stroke! Most
impressive, Princess!

I had a feeling our princess possessed exceptional
talent!
You're amazing, Iris!
Stop! The winner is Iris Midgar.
Congratulations, Iris.

Iris believes that it is her duty to win the Bushin
Festival.

She has no sense for politics, and accepts this
about herself.

All she can do is be a beacon of strength for her
kingdom.

Leave restoring order in the hinterlands to the
locals. There's no reason for you to intervene
in person.

We can't go about depriving the Dark Knight
Association of their work, either...

But most importantly, there are certain tasks that
only you can perform, Princess.
Princess Iris...
is finally joining the Knight Order!

Iris Midgar's mission is to bring peace of mind to
the land with her presence.

She bears this responsibility upon her shoulders as
one would a palanquin.

Iris also understands that, with strength being the
only weapon at her disposal, she's susceptible to
being used as a political pawn by others.
...That is, until recently.

Play your assigned role as a spectator and keep
your eyes on the stage.

You mean to tell me I should simply watch and do
nothing?

Please do not be unreasonable. Without magic, even
you are powerless here.
Why, Father?!

The murdered archbishop and the slain men were both
used by the Cult of Diablos!
The Church is all butâ€”
And yet you have no proof, do you not?

To seize said evidence, we need to release a royal
mad dog!
Acting impetuously will create too many enemies.

Even if your deeds are just, we cannot assume those
who are unaware of the circumstances will perceive
them as being so.
But...

Furthermore, at present, we have not only the Bushin
Festival, but also many honored guests from abroad, to
whom we must play host.

This is certainly not a time where I can afford to
present myself as being antagonistic toward the
Church.
Still, to let this go overlooked would be...
Iris.

Do you not think you are choosing to place the
kingdom in harm's way in order to prove
yourself right?

Her attempt to stand on her own two feet has unmasked
the truth.

Despite having founded the Crimson Order out of
concerns about the future of the kingdom, she had
proven unable to assemble the manpower or
funding to change anything.

Though she has managed to gather more recruits
with time, the order is still far from what she hoped
it to be.

Having said that, dabbling in politics now would only
end with her being taken advantage of.

Her only option is to leave affairs of state to
others and focus her efforts in areas where
she excels.

She knows popularity among the people can be a
great source of power, and she is beginning to
gather talented personnel whom she can entrust
to the brainwork of the order.

If she can secure victory at the Bushin Festival and
solidify her support from the citizenry, she is almost
guaranteed favorable results.
I will win... I swear it!
